data.title: Renault and Nissan have reached an agreement to reduce French participation
data.meta_description: Renault and Nissan have reached an agreement for the reduction of the French stake. Read the news on Agenzia Nova
data.text:
The reduction of the French stake in Nissan was the focus of a meeting in Japan between the CEOs of Renault and Nissan, Luca de Meo and Makoto Uchida, on January 26

© Agenzia Nova - Reproduction reserved

Renault Sa. and Nissan Motor Co. have reached an agreement to significantly reduce France's stake in Nissan from the current 43 percent to 15 percent. This was reported by the newspaper "Nikkei", recalling that the two car manufacturers had been discussing for years a restructuring of their decades-old capital alliance, heavily biased in favor of the French company. According to the newspaper, the two companies could formalize the agreement through a note during the day today. The reduction of the French stake in Nissan was the focus of a meeting in Japan between the CEOs of Renault and Nissan, Luca de Meo and Makoto Uchida, on January 26.

The agreement should lead to a situation of equity participation, with both builders owning a 15 percent stake in the partner company. Nissan is also evaluating the purchase of a stake in Ampere, Renaut's electric car business which in the future should receive an investment from the US microchip giant Qualcomm Technologies, and a collaboration agreement with Google LLC. The alliance between Renault and Nissan was also the subject of talks held in Paris by French President Emmanuel Macron and Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida in early January. On that occasion Macron had declared that the French government, the main shareholder of Renault, supports the revision of the corporate partnership.
